history.content:
Typically if you graduate in December, you attend department graduations the next May, not the one before.

------------------------------------

I actually disagree with the above response, as I know several people who are walking in the spring before they graduate. However, it's really up to you -- Think about some of these questions: Do you want to walk now? Is it more convenient for you/your family/friends who want to see you? Do you want to walk with friends?

------------------------------------

OP Here, I decided to walk as I don't want to come back the following May. I think it's just a pretty anxiety inducing time for me, especially after trying on my cap and gown. Thank you both for taking the time to answer this

Typically if you graduate in December, you attend department graduations the next May, not the one before.

^ I actually disagree, I know several people who are walking in the spring before they graduate. However, it's really up to you -- Think about some of these questions: Do you want to walk now? Is it more convenient for you/your family/friends who want to see you? Do you want to walk with friends?
Typically if you graduate in December, you attend department graduations the next May, not the one before.

I plan to walk in the campus wide commencement this December, but was wondering if it's normal to walk at spring commencement if I am graduating in the Fall. https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/commencement suggests that this is expected, but wanted to see what you all thought of this.
history.subject: Fa' 22 EGT, LSCS comp sci commencement
